author: Eurosport_ES
title: Tchouaméni se perderá el derbi por una amarilla en el último minuto y Ancelotti tiene un problema
text: LaLiga 2023/24 | Tchouaméni se perderá el derbi por una amarilla en el último minuto y Ancelotti tiene un problema PorEurosport Actualizado 01/02/2024 a las 22:59 GMT Aurelien Tchouaméni vio la cartulina amarilla en el último minuto del Getafe-Real Madrid, de la jornada 20 de LaLiga 2023/24, y se perderá el derbi del próximo domingo por acumulación de tarjetas. El francés actuó como central en la segunda parte, debido a que Antonio Rüdiger tuvo que ser sustutiudo por un golpe en la rodilla, por lo que es duda para el duelo ante el Atlético de Madrid. El centrocampista francés Aurelien Tchouaméni será baja para el italiano Carlo Ancelotti, técnico del Real Madrid, con miras al partido del domingo frente al Atlético de Madrid por acumulación de tarjetas amarillas. El galo vio la quinta cartulina del curso en LaLiga EA Sports este jueves en el Coliseum, en los últimos instantes del partido contra el Getafe, por una entrada abajo sobre Jordi Martín. Un contratiempo serio para Ancelotti, ya que Tchouaméni era su central de emergencia, como ocurrió frente al Getafe, y no podrá jugar contra el Atlético de Madrid. Además, la estadística contra el conjunto colchonero sin Tchouaméni de inicio no le acompaña. En los dos duelos en los que el galo ha sido suplente de los tres precedentes en la actual temporada entre ambos equipos, el Real Madrid los ha perdido. VOTA | La polémica: ¿Hubo penalti de Gastón a Brahim en los minutos finales? Problema central en el Real Madrid Con el alemán Antonio Rüdiger dejando el partido en el Coliseum al descanso tras sufrir un "fuerte golpe en el muslo izquierdo", según informaron fuentes del Real Madrid, y las graves lesiones de rodilla, rotura del ligamento cruzado de Èder Militao y David Alaba, Ancelotti solo cuenta con un central sano en la primera plantilla: Nacho Fernández. Eso sí, el italiano fue optimista con poder recuperar al alemán, aunque está pendiente de pruebas en las próximas horas "Creo que puede recuperarse. Tiene un golpe, veremos en los próximos días”, señaló. Además, se pronunció sobre los pocos efectivos con los que cuenta en el centro de la zaga y la decisión del club de no acudir al mercado invernal para reforzar dicha posición: “El central lo tenemos, porque Tchoauméni lo ha hecho muy bien. Si no tenemos a Rüdiger meteremos a otro central que, si no está acostumbrado a jugar ahí, lo hará muy bien”, aseguró. Temas relacionados Compartir este artículo Partidos relacionados Anuncio Ad Anuncio Ad

author: 共享联盟·台州 朱玲巧 徐仙金
title: "湾星"力量--台州湾新区拓荒奋进之路-台州频道
text:
7月20日，台州湾新区队捧起“浙BA”台州赛区冠军奖杯。
谁能想到，这支冠军之师竟来自一座成立不到5年、总人口刚过20万的产业新城？
“我们叫‘湾星人’，湾是台州湾的湾，星是摘星揽月的星。”赛场内外这个诗意的称谓，是台州湾新区5年来“拓荒破土、向新而生”的奋进密码。
湾，是从滩涂起步到新城崛起
“去年4月筹备篮球协会时，我们连一支完整的球队名单都凑不齐。”台州湾新区篮球协会会长张森回忆。
他的手机里，还存着当时向球队核心人物金甬仑、周浩送副会长聘任证书的照片——正是这样“一个个挖掘、一步步聚拢”，球队才从无到有。即使如此，他们的“浙BA”报名表也一直拖到最后一刻才敲定。
没人相信他们会赢，就像5年前没人敢想，这片滩涂能长出新城。
2020年新区成立之初，面临“产业基础薄弱、城市功能空白、要素保障不足”的三重挑战，“拓荒者”执笔，写下“三年打基础、五年见成效、十年立新城”的蓝图。
如今站在云湖城市核心区，蓄水完成的湖面倒映着周边火热建设的塔吊。
云湖周边，首期建设将重点推动15个项目，投资总额达150亿元，这无疑是中央创新区城市建设的“点睛之笔”，或将成为台州的“陆家嘴”。
星，是从低空逐梦到向新而生
“湾星人”的“星”，是仰头向上的真卫星。
新区一开始就将目光投向星辰大海，在“空天未来产业先导区”播下创新种子——全省首批低空经济“先飞区”，全省首支省级低空经济产业基金如活水般滋养产业土壤，航天彩虹、北方长鹰等“天空战队”在此集结，一条从无人机研发到场景应用的完整产业链正舒展羽翼。
走进吉利卫星超级工厂，一尘不染的车间里，精密仪器正书写着“台州智造”的传奇。借鉴汽车产业的智能化量产经验，这里实现了卫星制造的颠覆性突破：设计生产周期从传统的数月压缩至28天以内，日产1至2颗、年产500颗卫星的产能，将生产成本降低45%。
不久前，从新区“出征”的浙江妙月航天的微纳卫星，搭载8谱段全色多光谱载荷，在500公里轨道高度仍能清晰捕捉地面细节。预计到2027年底，由28颗卫星组成的“鲲鹏星座”将全面建成，成为驱动县域经济数字化转型的“太空引擎”。
近年来，台州湾新区以“一星四机”产业体系为抓手，从零起步培育空天产业。星空智联、国星宇航等卫星项目先后落户台州湾新区，妙月航天的“整星制造”项目更让产业版图再添重彩。
人，是从散沙聚塔到同心成炬
在这次的比赛中，“湾”众一心的最强后援，让人印象深刻。
“我们没有超级巨星，但每个人都是拼命三郎。”篮球队教练洪峰的话，道破了“湾星人”团结成城的成事之道。
为了聚拢人才，他们像发掘篮球爱好者般“精准捕捉”，用社会影响力织密人才网络；为了培育产业，4支国资招商基金以16亿元总规模展开“教练式招商”，逐个突破产业链关键节点；为了锤炼队伍，“百日攻坚”行动交出27个新开工项目、23个竣工投产项目的答卷；方特“熊出没”主题酒店从开工到试运营的11个月“新区速度”，谋划空港一体化项目的战略眼光，背后是“引才、育才、用才、留才”的生态沃土。
从2020年挂牌时的传统工业园区，到如今未来产业方兴未艾、领跑全市的经济高地，台州湾新区用篮球冠军的逆袭，写下新时代垦荒精神的内核：所谓奇迹，不过是一群人把“不可能”变成“不，可能”！
浙江在线台州频道责任编辑： 周煜

author: Brenna Owen, The Canadian Press
title: B.C.'s Golden Ears park closed due to damage from atmospheric river
text:
A popular park in British Columbia's Lower Mainland remains closed due to damage from an atmospheric river weather system that drenched the province's south coast, triggering a mudslide and local flooding that killed three people.
The Environment Ministry says the storm that rolled over the region for three days starting on Oct. 18 left a trail of damage at Golden Ears Provincial Park, north of Maple Ridge.
A statement from the ministry says the province hopes to be able to reopen a portion of the park this fall, but the exact timeline is not yet clear.
It says park staff are working with engineers to assess the damage with an immediate focus on clearing plugged culverts and repairing roadways.
Nearby Coquitlam was among the hardest-hit areas as the atmospheric river dumped more than 250 millimetres of rain on the community that weekend.
An advisory posted to the park's website after the storm says it was "closed until further notice."
The ministry suggests that anyone who wants to visit the park should check the Golden Ears website for updates.
This report by The Canadian Press was first published Oct. 31, 2024.
Brenna Owen, The Canadian Press

author: newsdesk@westgaz.co.uk (Sam Jess, John Evely)
title: Bath Rugby player ratings from Gloucester Rugby win - 'Put himself in the England picture'
text: Bath Rugby edged past their fierce rivals Gloucester 17-10 on Sunday afternoon in a scrappy affair at a surprisingly dry Recreation Ground Stadium. Gloucester opened the scoring as they pounced on two early lineout errors from the hosts as Ruan Ackermann powered his way over from close range. Many of Bath's first team hadn't played since before Christmas and it showed as the attack looked flustered, sluggish and disconnect at times. However, two of the brightest stars, Will Muir and Tom de Glanville combined brilliantly down the touchline to give Bath their opening points of the match. Finn Russell missed with his conversion while Adam Hastings added a penalty. [READ MORE: Bath Rugby 17-10 Gloucester Rugby LIVE: Full reaction and highlights from the West Country derby](https://www.somersetlive.co.uk/sport/other-sport/bath-rugby-v-gloucester-live-9014870) Trailing 10-5 at halftime, Bath needed a fast start and they got just that as quick ball allowed Will Muir to find space before chipping ahead, with the ball evading the grasp and nutmegging Gloucester's scrum-half Englefield the winger on his 50th appearance was able to regather and score in the corner. Bath soon found their third try as a poor kick from the visitors allowed the hosts to counterattack. With some rare time and space, Russell delivered a floated wide pass to Lawrence who straightened the attacking drawing in Chris Harris before passing to de Glanville who crossed for Bath's third try. With the hosts riding a wave of momentum, they turned down multiple kicking opportunities but were unable to find the bonus-point try as they were held up four times in the space of 10 minutes. Those missed chances almost and should have proved costly, as Gloucester mounted a rare attack with just four minutes on the clock. As they went inches from the line, they pushed the gamble button and went wide but Adam Hastings' poor pass bounced off the turf and missed all its intended targets and sent Ollie Thorley on a wild goose chase before being smashed backwards by Joe Cokanasiga, securing the game for Bath in the process. Rugby reporter Sam Jess takes a closer look at the Bath player's performance.... 15 Tom de Glanville - 9 Two tries for the club he grew up watching against the derby rivals, what could be better? The only remaining starting back from the trip to Welford Road, de Glanville spent much of the first half kicking the ball but once in space was able to break the line. A two-one with Muir allowed de Glanville to score a lovely try first try. After a quiet start to the second half for the fullback, the Bath-born de Glanville found space from a counterattack and stepped his way past Thorley for a brilliant finish. It was a sensational performance for the local boy against the fierce rivals and he was named the official player of the match by broadcasters TNT Sport. 14 Joe Cokanasiga - 6 With England coaches watching on, Cokanasiga had a mixed outing. A brilliant line off centre Redpath put his side just short of the 22 early on, but that was the bright spot for a difficult first forty. The winger had limited chances but bumped Adam Hastings to give Bath a glorious chance however he was unable to gather the ball moments later from a challenging Finn Russell offload with the line begging. Cokanasiga's work under the high ball has vastly improved but when he gathered an excellent chip kick he then tried to force an offload that wasn't on. Another dropped ball moments later meant he had a half to forget. However, despite a quiet second half, the winger made a huge tackle on Ollie Thorley with Gloucester pushing for a late score and the equalising try and he forced the winger all the way back to the 22 before helping to win a turnover. 13 Ollie Lawrence - 7 It was a mixed day for Lawrence, some lovely lines were run but the hands weren't always there. A monster hit on Santi Carreras stopped any chance of a counterattack by the visitors. However, he did manage to create de Glanville's second try running onto a brilliant floated pass by Russell before drawing in Chris Harris allowing the space for the fullback to score. The centre might have had a rusty game in attack but made some great hits including on Harris with the clock in the red, chopping the centre stopping a vital attack and securing the game for Bath. 12 Cameron Redpath - 7 With Gregor Townsend in the stands, Redpath had an attritional game. He gathered a lovely chip from Russell to burst into Gloucester's half in a highlight moment early on but it was a game of what-if moments for the centre who make multiple half-breaks but struggled to get the killer pass away. Some neat footwork during the second half just gave Bath the extra edge and metres. A drop metre out from running a hard line of Spencer cost Bath a vital chance to score but the centre had a strong game. 11 Will Muir - 9 On the occasion of his 50th appearance for Bath, Muir showed great work with the boot. A half-break past Jonny May and a link-up with Tom de Glanville set up the fullback's and Bath's opening try. A kick in behind then nutmegged Gloucester's scrum-half Englefield allowing the 'Horse' to score a stunning solo try on his landmark day. The winger made metres with most carries and should at least be in the England conversation. 10 Finn Russell - 6 Looked lost for much of the first half with his timing slightly off, but Russell slowly improved. It was a strange game for the fly-half with a few passes hitting the deck and a few teammates not quite on the same page. A brilliant pass was all it took though as he floated a wide ball to Lawrence allowing the centre to create de Glanville's second try. One out of three kicks even if they were not the easiest meant Bath only held a seven-point lead despite scoring three tries and conceding just one. 9 Ben Spencer - 6 The scrum-half looked a little flustered at the breakdown as Gloucester applied all sorts of pressure. A few poor passes meant Bath's looked unusually slow. The scrum-half stepped it up particularly during the second half with some faster delivery and accuracy. Not his best outing but another derby win as captain, however his decision not to go for the posts when Bath were only seven points ahead almost came back to bite him. Spencer was clearly thinking about the bonus point for scoring four attacking tries but you have to get the win first. 1 Beno Obano - 7 Another man looking to put in a performance with the England coaches watching, Obano gave Bath some early scrum power. Monster carries during the sticky periods for Bath gave them some go-forward when they needed it most. 2 Tom Dunn - 6 The lineout got off to the worst start possible costing Bath dearly with first one not straight and the second a dummy throw on his own 5m line. Gloucester took full advantage, scoring as Ruan Ackerman scored from the resulting free-kick. The hooker made amends, nailing his next two before smashing into a few rucks that looked to be heading towards a Gloucester turnover. The hooker nearly scored a try but was held up on the try line. 3 Will Stuart - 5 Keeping his place from last weekend, Stuart was pinged at the first scrum of the day. Stuart put in a strong outing even if it wasn't flashy as Bath were on top in the setpiece battle. 4 Elliott Stooke - 6 The lock had some good moments with some nice running lines and attacking spells as he proved a good link option. A few errors at the lineout meant it wasn't all roses for Stooke but his power game adds plenty for Bath. 5 Charlie Ewels - 6 Some nice footwork around the field meant Ewels had a solid day even if it wasn't ground-breaking. Helped power GJ van Velze over the line for a try that was eventually disallowed as the TMO decided the ball looked to have been held up. 6 GJ van Velze - 6 Strong tackles in the opening exchanges and some good attacks showed van Velze isn't showing his age. A lovely spin move saw him break the Gloucester defence early in the match and the flanker thought he had scored in the season half after barging his way over the whitewash and the try initially given, by a TMO review saw the try scrubbed off. 7 Miles Reid - 7 With Bath often stalling in attack, Reid stepped up with some brilliant carries but was held up and denied a try in the second half. A brilliant turnover with 10 minutes left allowed Bath to clear their lines. The flanker was everywhere during the game and had another strong game. 8 Jaco Coetzee - 7 A surging run from the number eighth gave Bath early field position once Gloucester lock Alemanno caught the South African high. Some bright moments for the eight but his game was ended on just 48 minutes with a shoulder injury. Replacements 16 Niall Annett - 5 The lineout had struggled all day but Annett failed to improve it. Despite some heavy tackles, Annett's work was more negative rather than positive. 17 Thomas du Toit - 6 The South African added power off the bench and dominated in the scrum after his arrival. 18 Archie Griffin - N/A 19 Quinn Roux -N/A 20 Alfie Barbeary - 7 Off the bench, Barbeary added some go-forward with direct running lines, something that Bath had been missing for the first half. A few strong tackles, as well as great work rate, meant the replacement eight was out on his feet and even showed the fans more than asked for with a little post-match spew. 21 Tom Carr-Smith - N/A 22 Sam Harris - 6 With Gloucester attacking late on, Harris showed some bright moments in defence including helping Cokanasiga earn a turnover in what proved to be a crucial moment late on. 23 Chris Cleote - 7 Cleote was a late arrival onto the bench with Sam Underhill pulling out late on, but the South African remained calm, composed and became a nuisance slowing down Gloucester's ruck speed and coming up with at least one significant turnover.

author: Russ Mitchell
title: After recent heat wave, Southern California forecast is cooler weather - Los Angeles Times
text:
October started off with an unusual heat wave that some referred to as a “second summer,” but Southern Californians can look forward to slightly cooler temperatures over the next few days, according to the National Weather Service.
Temperatures will range from the mid- to low 70s along the coast to the high 80s in inland and valley areas Saturday, officials said. Cooler temperature across the region are expected to remain through much of next week.
“We’ll be losing a few degrees each day through the next few days,” said Mike Wofford at the National Weather Service. “The valleys will be cooler than they’ve been, too.”
Advertisement Most days will see low clouds and patchy fog in the morning that will clear up by midday, with no chance of rain or strong winds, he said. Some areas along the coast may see some drizzle in the morning.
“Not that exciting,” Wofford said. But given the recent heat wave, he said, “for L.A., that’s pretty nice.”
A couple of weather fronts moving through Northern California into next week are helping to deliver cooler air all the way down to the Los Angeles and San Diego areas, he said.
Advertisement In early October, Central and Southern California inland and valley areas saw temperatures range from the low 90s to as much as 110 degrees due to a high pressure system that swept over much of the southwestern region of the country.
More to Read

author: Yvonne Zusel
title: 15 restaurants we’re excited to see open in metro Atlanta in 2024
text:
A new year brings with it a slew of restaurants slated to debut in metro Atlanta over the next 12 months. Here are a few we’re particularly excited to see join the local dining scene.
Betty Sue’s . Bryant Williams, better known as Chef Baul, has found success in downtown Atlanta with takeout spot Binky’s, which opened last year. He plans to open all-day breakfast and brunch spot Betty Sue’s this year, with a focus on grits bowls topped with proteins like oxtail, lobster and shrimp. The bowls will be made with Williams’ Chef Baul’s Grits line, which will be available for purchase online and at the restaurant.
30 Marietta St., Atlanta.
Bom . Chef Brian So of acclaimed Marietta restaurant Spring is behind this recently announced Korean restaurant slated to open in the summer as part of Bridger Properties’ Church Street, a redevelopment project of more than 17,000 square feet of restaurants and businesses along Church Street off of Marietta Square. Soups, hot pots and other Korean dishes will be delivered to guests on rolling dining carts while Korean music videos and films play on TV screens. A storefront window will provide a view into the kitchen.
113 Church St., Marietta.
Explore Metro Atlanta restaurant openings
Credit: Courtesy of Fifth Group Restaurants
Credit: Courtesy of Fifth Group Restaurants
Ela . Fifth Group Restaurants closed long-time Mexican restaurant Real El Taco in Virginia-Highland last year, with plans to open this Mediterranean restaurant in the same space. The menu will feature a variety of Mediterranean cuisines including Greek, Moroccan, Israeli and Turkish, with a kitchen led by executive chef Darragh Dudley, a native of Dublin, Ireland, who previously worked in Michelin-starred restaurants in New York City before moving to Atlanta.
1186 N. Highland Ave. NE, Atlanta.
Fawn . Fresh off his win James Beard Foundation award win for Best Chef: Southeast, Terry Koval has plans to open amaro bar Fawn this spring in the former Sweet Seed Salad space on the Decatur Square, just steps away from his restaurants Deer and the Dove and B-Side. The 40-seat restaurant, which includes 10 bar seats, will feature small plates, available a la carte or as part of a tasting menu, with a focus on charcuterie and crudo. Beverage director Matt Watkins will design a small cocktail menu of stirred and amaro-forward drinks.
119 E. Ponce de Leon Ave., Decatur. instagram.com/fawn.wine.amaro.bar
Gene’s . Avery Cottrell will bring turn his pop-up into a brick-and-mortar in the former Salaryman space in the 2nd + Hosea development in East Lake this spring. In addition to his smoked meats, Cottrell will showcase dishes like fish sauce caramel sticky pork ribs garnished with herbs, peanuts and fried shallots; fish dip; and “stuffed eggs,” a version of deviled eggs that Cottrell plans to serve with a cracklin’ gremolata. Beverage offerings will include frozen drinks and Jell-O shots.
2371 Hosea L. Williams Drive, Atlanta. genesgenesgenes.com
J’ouvert Caribbean Kitchen . Tasha Cyril, who owns Belle & Lily’s Caribbean Brunch House, is behind this forthcoming Caribbean concept that will be part of the Uptown Atlanta development (formerly Lindbergh City Center). Expect to see items like jerk wings and chicken, pina colada French toast, curry mushroom roti, passion fruit pancakes and Trinidadian doubles, as well as a weekend brunch with live music. Look for J’ouvert to open in February or March.
500 Lindbergh Drive NE, Atlanta.
La Metro . Chef Hector Santiago has been a mainstay in Atlanta for more than 20 years, with restaurants including El Super Pan (with locations at Ponce City Market and The Battery ) , El Burro Pollo in Midtown and the now-shuttered Pura Vida. His latest Spanish-inspired concept is expected to open in the former Biltong Bar space in Ponce City Market this summer. The menu will feature small plates like patatas bravas, croquetas, endive with anchovies and grilled mushrooms, along with bigger portions of bocadillos (sandwiches), canelones (stuffed pasta rolls), lamb with olives, fideua (paella made with pasta), and seasonal paella. Patrons can also expect a selection of Spanish wines and cocktails.
675 Ponce de Leon Ave. NE, Atlanta. lametroatl.com
Lucky Star . The team behind popular metro Atlanta restaurants Momonoki, Cafe Momo , Brush Sushi and Cuddlefish is set to open cocktail-focused Lucky Star in the Star Metals development this year. The L-shaped front bar will serve coffee, matcha drinks and draft cocktails throughout the day. Food offerings will include Momo Cafe-style items including filled croissants and mille crepe cakes, as well as Taiwanese fried chicken sandwiches. When patrons walk down a hallway and through an archway, they will find a reservation-only back bar that will likely offer a cocktail omakase experience.
1055 Howell Mill Road, Atlanta. instagram.com/luckystaratl
Mothers Best. Ean Bancroft and Ross Winecoff plan to turn their fried chicken pop-up Mother’s Best into a brick-and-mortar this spring in the former Calle Latina space in Decatur. The menu will feature fried chicken buckets and chicken sandwiches served with housemade sauces and sides. For this business venture, the pair are partnering with Donald Durant and Armando Celentano, the owners of Argosy in East Atlanta and Sceptre Brewing Arts in Oakhurst.
406 Church St., Decatur. instagram.com/mothers.best
Nadair . Local celebrity chef and former “Top Chef” contestant Kevin Gillespie has taken over Anne Quatrano’s storied Floataway Cafe space. Gillespie, who also owns Gunshow, called Nàdair “the next chapter in a story we began many years ago at Woodfire Grill,” referring to the now-shuttered Atlanta restaurant where he started his career as a restaurateur. While the concept is expected to open in 2024, a specific opening date has not been announced.
1123 Zonolite Road NE, Atlanta.
Okay Anny’s and Politan Row at Ashford Lane . Slated to open in the coming weeks, food hall Politan Row at Ashford Lane will be home to food and beverage concepts including Bucatini Ristorante, Mamacita’s Cuban Cantina, Pretty Little Tacos, Smokehouse Q, Chef Viet and Delilah’s Everyday Soul. An ‘80s and ‘90s-themed bar called Okay Anny’s will also be part of the lineup. Politan Group is also behind the food hall at Colony Square and a forthcoming hall at the Form at Peachtree Corners.
4500 Olde Perimeter Way, Dunwoody. ashfordlane.politanrow.com
Pendolino . Chef Kevin Maxey, who spent several years working for Ford Fry’s Rocket Farms Restaurant Group and was a driving force behind the group’s Superica restaurant plans to open his own eatery later this year in the Chastain Market development in Sandy Springs. The Italian restaurant will be located in the former Santorini Taverna space.
4279 Roswell Road, Atlanta. instagram.com/pendolinoatl
Redacted Basement Drink Parlor. It’s been five years since Judy Ho and Jake Karmin announced plans to open a conspiracy theory-inspired bar on the Georgia Avenue restaurant and retail corridor in Atlanta’s Summerhill neighborhood. After several delays, the bar is expected to open this spring.
63 Georgia Ave., Atlanta. instagram.com/redactedbasementdrinkparlor
Credit: Courtesy photo
Credit: Courtesy photo
Skol and Valhalla Social. Craft brewery Skol and Valhalla Social, an “eatertainment” concept with games, food and drinks are both set to open in the coming months on Peachtree Street in downtown Atlanta. Skol will feature eight beers and a Nordic-inspired menu from Rich Rosendale, a certified master chef who also oversees culinary operations for adjoining restaurant R3 Rosendale Concepts, catering and events business Rosendale Events and Southern Exchange Ballrooms event operations. Located above Skol, Valhalla Social will have its own food and drink menu along with axe throwing, pool tables, shuffleboards, basketball, skeeball, foosball, ping pong and darts.
200 Peachtree St., Atlanta. instagram.com/skolbrewatl
Explore Nordic-inspired brewery, ‘eatertainment’ concept coming to downtown Atlanta Switchman Hall . Slated to open this spring, Switchman Hall food hall in the Terminal South development will bring more than 15 food stalls to Atlanta’s Peoplestown neighborhood. Food hall tenants will include Life Bistro , Original Hot Dog Factory, Perfect Seasoning, Southern Grace , Tiger K Cup Bob, Sabu K Ramen and The Cream , along with dine-in concept Pur Zen Mimosa Wine Bar.
1155 Hank Aaron Drive Se, Atlanta. terminalsouth.com
Explore The ultimate guide to comfort food in metro Atlanta Sign up for the AJC Food and Dining Newsletter
Read more stories like this by liking Atlanta Restaurant Scene on Facebook , following @ATLDiningNews on Twitter and @ajcdining on Instagram .
About the Author
Yvonne Zusel Yvonne Zusel has been with the AJC since 2010. She worked on the digital news and arts and entertainment teams before joining the food and dining team.

author: Matt Davey
title: Cold health warning as Southampton temperatures to plummet
text:
An amber cold health alert has been issued for Southampton as temperatures plummet across the country The UK Health Security Agency has issued the alert across the South East from 12 midday today – Thursday, January 2 – until 12 midday on Wednesday, January 8.
Daytime temperatures in the coming days will drop as low as 4C, with a chance of the region seeing snowfall on Saturday.
READ MORE: Met Office hour-by-hour forecast for Southampton cold snap
In a statement, a spokesperson…
Matt Davey

author: lavozdegalicia
title: Rusia ratifica el tratado de asistencia militar mutua con Corea del Norte
text:
Rusia ratificó este jueves el tratado de asistencia militar mutua con Corea del Norte , lo que incrementa el temor occidental de que soldados de este país puedan ser utilizados en la guerra de Ucrania, lo que ha sido calificado también por el Gobierno surcoreano de «provocación» ante la que «no permanecerá con los brazos cruzados». El Gobierno de Rusia justificó esta alianza alegando que no se trata de un pacto ofensivo, sino defensivo. El viceministro de Exteriores Andrei Rudenko insistió en el debate parlamentario en que deriva de las «alarmantes» tendencias políticas y militares a nivel global .
Guterres le dice a Putin cara a cara que detenga su guerra en Ucrania Rafael M. Mañueco
También el presidente de la comisión de Asuntos Exteriores de la Duma, Leonid Slutski, incidió en la «situación geopolítica actual» para abogar por ampliar la cooperación con el régimen de Kim Jong-un, «sobre la base de los principios de respeto mutuo de la soberanía y la integridad territorial y la no injerencia en los asuntos internos», informan las agencias rusas.
Una alianza enmascarada
Sin embargo, la OTAN pudo confirmar que «ya se han desplegado soldados norcoreanos en Rusia» que tendrían como destino final el frente ucraniano y supondría una «escalada significativa», según la portavoz de la Alianza, Farah Dakhlallah .
El presidente surcoreano, Yoon Suk-yeol dijo por su parte que Corea del Sur podría considerar la posibilidad de proporcionar armas a Ucrania, dependiendo del grado de cooperación militar entre Moscú y Piongyang. Yoon prometió además que su país no se quedará «de brazos cruzados» ante el posible despliegue de tropas norcoreanas para apoyar al Ejército ruso en Ucrania.
La respuesta del líder surcoreano se produce después de que Washington se uniera ayer a Kiev y Seúl a la hora de confirmar la presencia de soldados norcoreanos, alrededor de 3.000, en suelo ruso.

author: Olivia Stevens
title: FBI seeks public help to find suspect in Lansing bank robbery
text:
By Olivia Stevens | | Daily Southtown UPDATED: August 15, 2024 at 4:04 p.m.
The FBI is seeking information on an unnamed person suspected of robbing the First Savings Bank of Hegewisch in Lansing Aug. 9, and offering a reward of up to $10,000.
Chicago FBI classified the suspect Wednesday as a 40- to 60-year-old white man dressed in a dark-colored baseball hat, black sunglasses, a light-colored medical face mask, a purple and green plaid button-up short sleeved shirt with a black undershirt, dark-colored cargo pants and dark-colored shoes. He also wore a watch on his right wrist and carried a blue Walmart shopping bag, the release said. (FBI Chicago)
Special Agent Siobhan Johnson said Wednesday security footage captured the person walking slowly across the lobby and sitting down, taking his time before ordering people in the bank to a back room and demanding money. Johnson declined to say how much money the person was given, but said his approach to wait in the lobby before robbing the bank is “unusual.”
“In most bank robberies that we see, typically fast very hurrying in and out,” Johnson said. The FBI description said the person implied he had a handgun, but the weapon has not been confirmed.
Lansing police and the FBI responded at about 10 a.m. and are actively searching for the man. Johnson said any details from the public, even those given anonymously, can help and potentially earn the reward.
“Bank robbers don’t just appear and disappear as soon as they go into the bank,” Johnson said. “Someone saw him changing into this clothing or changing out of this clothing at some point. Someone saw him walking through the neighborhood, either getting into a bus or getting into a car, and those are the things we’re really looking for.”
The FBI asks anyone with information to report it at 312-421-6700 or tips.fbi.gov .
ostevens@chicagotribune.com August 15, 2024 at 3:22 p.m. Share this:
